validation.blacklisted: Field must not be any of the following values: {values}
validation.ipAddress: Field must be a valid IP address

ip: With IP v4 range groups you can group the SEB client connections within a IP ranges.
Every SEB client that is connected with a given client IP address that is within the
defined range (including start and end address) belongs to this group.
This is mostly useful if you have dedicated managed devices where you know
the IP ranges for e.g. your computer rooms.
os: With SEB Client groups you can group the SEB client connections within the
operating system they are running on.
For this grouping type there is a defined SEB OS type for each
supported OS; Windows, MacOS and iOS.
This is mostly useful if you want to monitor and manage
the SEB clients by different operating system types to give respective support.
alphabetical: With this group you can define an alphabetical range to collect SEB Clients by user session name.
The range is defined by an inclusive starting letter and an inclusive end letter.
There is no additional check if your defined groups covering the whole alphabet
Furthermore since the user session name can change during the SEB Connection phase, the group belonging of a SEB Client can change too.

loginPage.title: SEB Server
loginPage.description: Please fill the form to sign in to your SEB Server Account.

assessmentTool.title: Select Assessment Tool
assessmentTool.description: Please select an assessment tool to continue.

examMain.title: Select Exam
examMain.description: Search and select the exam you want to prepare.

templateMain.title: Choose Exam Template
templateMain.description: Click on the Exam Template you want to use for the exam.

passwordMain.title: Set Quit Password
passwordMain.description: Set the quit password, otherwise a student can easily quit SEB.
passwordMain.warning: This password should be kept confidential and shared only with exam supervisors

info.EXAM: This strategy does not allow you to toggle the screen proctoring per group.
info.APPLY_SEB_GROUPS: With this strategy, you must create at least one group with screen proctoring enabled.

naming.title: Define Basic Settings
naming.subtitle: Fill out the form. Create a SEB Client Template and a Connection Configuration, if you haven't done so already.

name.label: Name
name.placeholder: Enter a name for the exam template
name.validationErrorUniqueName: An exam template with this name already exists

name.label: Name
name.validationErrorUniqueName: An indicator with this name already exists on this exam template

clientGroup.title: Add Groups
clientGroup.subtitle: Add the groups, you want for your exam template. You can only use Screen Proctoring for a group, if you enabled Screen Proctoring in the first step.

name.label: Name
name.validationErrorUniqueName: A group with this name already exists on this exam template

ipRangeStart.placeholder: Enter the start of the IP range

ipRangeEnd.label: End of IP range

nameRangeStartLetter.label: Start Letter

nameRangeEndLetter.label: End Letter
nameRangeEndLetter.placeholder: Enter the end letter of the name range

validation.invalidRoleSelection: Please select at least one Role

role.pleaseselect: Please select a Role for the User Account

info.SEB_SERVER_ADMIN: SEB Server Admin role info text

changeAssessmentToolStatusContext.deactivateMessage: Are you sure you want to deactivate {name}?

changeConnectionConfigurationStatusConte.deactivateMessage: Are you sure you want to deactivate {name}?

validation.mustBeWithUrl: Must start with http:// or https://
validation.mustBeNumber: The value can only consist of numbers
validation.mustBePositiveNumber: The value must be a positive number

validation.mustBeWithUrl: Must start with http:// or https://
validation.mustBeNumber: The value can only consist of numbers
validation.mustBePositiveNumber: The value must be a positive number

certificateDialog.uploadCertificateHelp: Drag and Drop or Search through File Explorer
certificateDialog.uploadFailed: Failed to upload certificate, please contact a system administrator
certificateDialog.keystorePasswordIncorrect: The password was incorrect. Please try again or contact a system administrator

createTemplate.info: What kind of template do you want to create?
createTemplate.configurationTemplateTeaser: In the SEB Client Template you define the SEB Settings. These are sent to the SEB clients installed on the students' devices. The SEB clients then reconfigure using these settings. The SEB Client Template is needed to set up an Exam Template.
createTemplate.examTemplateTeaser: In the Exam Template you define everything needed to prepare an exam in SEB Server. You define which SEB Settings will be used by selecting a SEB Client Template. You also define which Connection Configuration to be used. By choosing Exam Supervisors, you decide, who shall supervise the exam. You also define which indicators and which groups shall be used, when applying this Exam Template to an exam. If there is no SEB Client Template, nor a Connection Configuration, please create these first.

sebSettings.pwdMismatch: The password and confirm password must match
sebSettings.pwdSpaces: The value must not start or end with a space.

generalView.allowQuit_tooltip:
Users can quit SEB with Control-Q, window close or quit button.
Otherwise use a quit link in your exam system or shutdown/restart the computer.

view_mode.title: Browser View Mode
view_mode.0_tooltip: Use window for the SEB browser which can be scaled and moved around, also to another screen of available
view_mode.1_tooltip: Display the SEB browser full screen
view_mode.2_tooltip: Mainly to be used on Windows tablets. In Windows 10, Tablet Mode needs to be activated. Not working with the Create New Desktop kiosk mode, you have to reconfigure the SEB client settings to Disable Explorer Shell.

main_browser.title: Main Browser Window Size and Position
main_browser.width_tooltip: Window width in pixel or percentage of total screen width
main_browser.height_tooltip: Window height in pixel or percentage of total screen height

browser_window.title: Browser Window Toolbar
browser_window.enableToolbar_tooltip: Displays a toolbar on top of the browser window which can also be hidden by the user
browser_window.addrBar: Allow address bar for main window (Win)
browser_window.newAddrBar: Allow address bar for additional window (Win)
browser_window.allowDev: Show developer tools in window menu (Win)
browser_window.hideTool_tooltip: Hide browser window toolbar by default. It can be shown again by using the View menu or Alt-Command-T.
browser_window.showMenuBar_tooltip: Show the OS X menu bar to allow to access settings like Wi-Fi

task_bar.title: SEB Taskbar / Dock
task_bar.showTaskBar_tooltip: The SEB task bar shows and switches between open browser windows, allowed resources and applications and displays additional controls
task_bar.raiseHandButtonAlwaysPromptMessage_toolt: if this is enabled the raise hand function will always prompt the user to give a message for the raise hand action
task_bar.allowWlan_tooltip: Allows to reconnect to WiFi networks which have previously been connected to
task_bar.showReloadButton_tooltip: Reloads current web page. Shows warning if enabled in Browser settings tab
task_bar.showInputLanguage_tooltip: Shows current keyboard layout and allows to switch between other active keyboard layouts

zoom.title: Enable Zoom (Win/Mac)
zoom.enableZoomPage_tooltip: Pages can be zoomed with ctrl - cmd +/- or the commands in the view menu and browser window toolbar (Mac)
zoom.enableZoomText_tooltip: Text in browser windows can be zoomed with cmd +/- or the commands in the view menu and browser window toolbar (Mac)

audio.title: Audio Control
audio.enableControl_tooltip: Displays an audio control in the SEB taskbar
audio.mute_tooltip: The audio is muted when the SEB/exam starts
audio.volume_tooltip: The volume level after starting SEB/exam

spellChecker.title: Spell Checker
spellChecker.allow: Allow spell checking (Win supports English only)
spellChecker.allow_tooltip: Allow to use 'Check spelling' in the SEB browser
spellChecker.allowDict_tooltip: Allow to use the OS X dictionary lookup using a 3 finger tap

links.title: Links requesting to be opened in a new browser window (Mac)
links.block: Block when directing to a different server
links.block_tooltip: USE WITH CARE: Hyperlinks invoked by JavaScript/plug-ins which direct to a different host than the one of the current main page will be ignored.

window.title: New browser window size and position
window.width_tooltip: Window width in pixel or percentage of total screen width
window.height_tooltip: Window height in pixel or percentage of total screen height

security.title: Browser security
security.toolbar: Allow toolbar of internal PDF reader (Win)
security.toolbar_tooltip: This enables access to the print and download dialogs
security.print_tooltip: This does not allow printing via internet PDF reader (see below)!
security.cache: Delete cache when re-configuring or terminating SEB (Win)
security.cache_tooltip: This setting is ignored if 'Clear browser session when ending' in section Exam > Session Handling is deactivated!
security.errorReload_tooltip: In some web applications, retrying to load a failed URL after a connection error causes issues. When enabled, a full page reload is performed instead
security.browserWindowWebViewClassicHideDeprecati: Classic WebView is deprecated on macOS and no longer supported on iOS/iPadOS! The used SEB assessment solution integration/settings might no longer work and need to be updated to support the modern WebView. This warning is displayed on top of browser windows/tabs when settings require the classic WebView. You can disable this warning being displayed, but if you are the vendor of an assessment system which isn't yet compatible with the modern WebView, you need to update your integration now (use SEB Javascript API instead of HTTP header check for BEK/CK, see safeexambrowser.org/developer).
security.enableRightMouse_tooltip: Enable to access context menu for Web Inspector in SEB for macOS (use ONLY for debugging). Disable to prevent right mouse button actions/context menu for sharing content (with modern WebView) and in browser plugins/video players

restrictions.title: Restrictions in Exam Window
restrictions.allowBackFor_tooltip: Disabling browsing to previously visited pages may increase security, because browsing back might allow to leave an exam
restrictions.allowReload_tooltip: Allow reload in the exam window with F5 reload button (if displayed)
restrictions.showReloadWarning_tooltip: User has to confirm reloading a web page with F5 or reload button
restrictions.showURL_tooltip: For some exam scenarios, you may want to keep URLs secret

restrictionsAdd.title: Restrictions in Additional Windows
restrictionsAdd.allowBackFor_tooltip: Disabling browsing to previously visited pages might not be desired for additional resources and other content opening in additional browser windows, therefore this additional setting
restrictionsAdd.allowReload_tooltip: Allow reload in additional window with F5 reload button (if displayed)
restrictionsAdd.showReloadWarning: Show reload warning in additional windows
restrictionsAdd.showReloadWarning_tooltip: User has to confirm reloading a web page with F5 or reload button
restrictionsAdd.showURL_tooltip: For some exam scenarios, you may want to keep URLs secret

browser.browserUserAgent: Suffix to be added to any user agent
browser.browserUserAgent_tooltip: This string is appended to any user agent in addition to the user agent generated with the other setting options
browser.windowTitleSuffix: Suffix to be added to every browser window
browser.windowTitleSuffix_tooltip: This string is appended to every browser window

uaDesktop.title: User agent for desktop mode
uaDesktop.0_tooltip: Zoom whole web pages using Ctrl-Mousewheel (Win)Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:52.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/52.0
uaDesktop.1_tooltip: Zoom only text on web pages using Ctrl-Mousewheel (Win)
uaDesktop.custom_tooltip: Custom desktop user agent string (SEB appends its version number automatically)

uaTouch.title: User agent for touch/tablet mode
uaTouch.0_tooltip: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:52.0; Touch) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/52.0
uaTouch.2_tooltip: Zoom only text on web pages using Ctrl-Mousewheel (Win)
uaTouch.custom_tooltip: This text is displayed as the title of the confirmation alert and as tooltip on the icon

uaMac.title: User agent (Mac)
uaMac.1_tooltip: Zoom only text on web pages using Ctrl-Mousewheel (Win)
uaMac.custom_tooltip: This text is displayed as the title of the confirmation alert and as tooltip on the icon

browser.enableSebBrowser_tooltip: Disable this to start another application in kiosk mode (for example a virtual desktop infrastructure client
browser.policy_tooltip: The modern WKWebView browser engine currently doesn't support URL content filters (Network > URL Filter > Filter Embedded Content) and sending the Browser Exam and Config Key in HTTP headers (Exam Session > Use Browser & Config Keys). If one of these settings is enabled, the classic WebView is used in the Automatic policy. Prefer Modern ignores the 'Use Browser & Config Keys' option in new tabs on a different server or generally.
browser.policy_2: Prefer Modern in New Tab+Different Host

media.title: Media Playback/Capture
media.autoplay_tooltip: Some video/audio content will start playing without user interaction. Some other content might not be playable without enabling this setting (but will not auto play)
media.audio_tooltip: Using the modern WebView, audio autoplay can be controlled separately
media.video_tooltip: Using the modern WebView, video autoplay can be controlled separately
media.camera_tooltip: Allow web sites to access the camera, for WebRTC live streams or still pictures (only in modern WebView and on macOS 11.1/iOS 14.3 or newer)
media.mic_tooltip: Allow web sites to access the microphone, for WebRTC live streams or audio recording (only in modern WebView and on macOS 11.1/iOS 14.3 or newer)
media.screen_tooltip: Allow web sites to capture the screen, for WebRTC live streams or still pictures (only in modern WebView and on macOS 11.1 or newer)
media.playback_tooltip: Video content can be played inline on a web page or only in full screen. By disabling this option, HTML5 video players are forced to use the iOS user interface for controlling playback
media.playbackPhone_tooltip: Video content can be played inline on a web page or only in full screen. By disabling this option, HTML5 video players are forced to use the iOS user interface for controlling playback

updownloadView.title: General Settings
updownloadView.allow_tooltip: Use for downloading exam results or to download/upload files for editing in permitted third party applications. Deprecated setting: start using separate settings for allowing downloads/uploads, but enable this general setting if either downloads or uploads should be enabled.
updownloadView.custom: Allow user to select custom download / upload directory (Win)
updownloadView.policy_tooltip: SEB can let users choose the file to upload or automatically use the same file which was down-loaded before. If not found, a file requester or an error is presented depending on this setting.
updownloadView.policy_1: by attempting to upload the same file downloaded before
updownloadView.policy_2: by only allowing to upload the same file downloaded before
updownloadView.download: Download and open PDF files instead of displaying them inline
updownloadView.download_tooltip: PDF files will not be displayed by SEB but downloaded and opened (if 'Open files after downloading' is active!) by the application set in Finder (usually Preview or Adobe Acrobat).
updownloadView.allowPDFPlugin: Allow using Acrobat Reader PDF plugin (insecure! Mac only)
updownloadView.allowPDFPlugin_tooltip: The Adobe Acrobat Reader browser plugin should only be used on secured managed Mac computers, at it allows limited access the file system and unlimited to cloud services
updownloadView.andOpen: Download and open SEB Config Files
updownloadView.andOpen_tooltip: Download and open .seb config files regardless if downloading and opening other file types is allowed
updownloadView.files_tooltip: Allows uploading files, selected manually (or on macOS automatically). Currently also setting 'allow downloading and uploading files' needs to be enabled
updownloadView.photos_tooltip: Uploading allows to access camera, the full photo library and iCloud Drive and therefore is insecure!

filetypes.title: File types to be downloaded
filetypes.tooltip: Specify file types which will be downloaded instead of displayed by the browser. You can also indicate the associated additional app for the file type and use the option 'Open files after downloading' above. This feature might not be supported on all platforms

sessionHandling.title: Session Handling
sessionHandling.text: Use the following parameter to control whether a browser session is persistent on disk, e.g. to keep users logged in after a reconfiguration
sessionHandling.examSessionClearCookiesOnStart: Clear browser session when starting an exam or staring SEB
sessionHandling.examSessionClearCookiesOnEnd: Clear browser session when ending an exam or terminating SEB (prevents deletion of browser cache if deactivated!)

quitLink.title: Link to quit SEB after exam
quitLink.quitURL: Place this quit link to the 'feedback' page displayed after an exam was successfully finished. Clicking that link will quit SEB without having to enter the quit password.

back.title: Back to Start Button
back.text: The back to start button reloads the exam's Start URL
back.restartExamUseStartURL_tooltip: The back to start button reloads the exam's Start URL
back.restartExamURL_text: Enter custom URL or select 'Use Start URL' to display a back to start button in the SEB taskbar.
back.restartExamText_text: Title/tool tip text for the back to start button (leave empty for localized standard text)
back.restartExamPasswordProtected: Protect back to start button with the quit/unlock password
back.restartExamPasswordProtected_tooltip: The quit/restart password (if set) must be entered when the back to start button was pressed

reconfigure.title: Reconfiguring Exam Session
reconfigure.examSessionReconfigureAllow_tooltip: Allow reconfiguring by loading an SEB exam config file (while using the client config or during an exam session). If the running session has a quit password set, indicate the allows URL of the new exam config in Reconfiguring URL (wildcard character '*' can be used).

query.title: Query String Parameter
query.startURLAppendQueryParameter_tooltip: If a seb(s):// link contains additional query string, SEB appends it to the exam's Start URL.

applicationView.allowSwitchToApplications: Allow switching to third party application (Mac)
applicationView.allowSwitchToApplications_tooltip:
Decreases security of the kiosk mode by allowing process switcher (Cmd+Tab).
The blacked out background of SEB also doesn't cover some alerts and modal windows in this mode.
applicationView.allowFlashFullscreen: Allow Flash to switch to fullscreen mode (Mac)

permittedProcess.active_tooltip: This permitted process item is active
permittedProcess.os_tooltip: Indicates on which operating system the permitted process runs
permittedProcess.title: Title
permittedProcess.title_tooltip:
Application title which is displayed in the application chooser.
 Background processes don't have a title, because they can't be selected by users.
permittedProcess.description_tooltip:
Optional, should explain what kind of process this is,
 because this might not be obvious only from the executable's name.
permittedProcess.executable_tooltip:
File name of the executable, which should not contain any parts of a file system path,
 only the filename of the exe file (like calc.exe).
permittedProcess.identifier_tooltip:
(Sub) string in the title of the main window of a tricky third party application (Java, Acrobat etc.).
 Mac OS X: Bundle identifier of the process in reverse domain notation.
permittedProcess.iconInTaskbar_tooltip:
Show icon of permitted application in task bar
 (not possible when 'run in background' is enabled).
permittedProcess.autostart_tooltip: Start the process automatically together with SEB
permittedProcess.runInBackground_tooltip:
Allow the permitted process to already be running when SEB starts.
 Such a process can't have an icon in the task bar.
permittedProcess.allowUserToChooseApp: Allow user to select location of application
permittedProcess.strongKill_tooltip:
Terminate process in a not-nice way,
which may cause data loss if the application had unsaved data
permittedProcess.allowOpenAndSavePanel_tooltip:
When using AAC Assessment Mode,
SEB blocks the macOS Open File and Save As panel.
Users cannot browse the file system and open files manually
in most permitted apps with AAC Multi App Mode.
permittedProcess.allowShareSheet_tooltip:
When using AAC Assessment Mode, SEB blocks the macOS share sheet.
Users cannot share documents in permitted apps with AAC Multi App Mode.
permittedProcess.allowManualStart_tooltip:
Allow user to start the additional application with its Dock icon.
Otherwise the app can be started by downloading and opening its documents
permittedProcess.allowNetworkAccess_tooltip: Allow the permitted app in AAC Multi App Mode to access the network/internet
permittedProcess.teamIdentifier_tooltip: Team identifier of the app's code signature

prohibitedProcess.active_tooltip: Indicates if this prohibited process item is active
prohibitedProcess.description_tooltip:
Optional, to explain what kind of process this is,
 because this might not be obvious only from the executable's name.
prohibitedProcess.executable_tooltip:
File name of the executable, which should not contain any parts of a file system path,
 only the filename of the exe file (like calc.exe).
prohibitedProcess.identifier_tooltip:
Title of the main window of a Java third party application.
 Mac OS X: Bundle identifier of the process in reverse domain notation.
prohibitedProcess.strongKill_tooltip:
Terminate process in a not-nice way,
which may cause data loss if the application had unsaved data
prohibitedProcess.ignoreAAC_tooltip:
When using the AAC kiosk mode
(which prevents network and screen access for other processes),
ignore this prohibited process

networkView.ExceptionsList: Bypass proxy settings for these hosts and domains

sebService.title: SEB Service (Win)
sebService.note: IMPORTANT: The SEB Service changes aspects of the system configuration. Some anti-virus software providers might falsely identify its operation as malicious, thus it is not recommended to use the SEB Service in uncontrolled environments (e.g. BYOD).
sebService.sebServicePolicy_0: allow to run SEB without service
sebService.sebServicePolicy_1: display warning when service is not running
sebService.sebServicePolicy_2: allow to use SEB only with service
sebService.sebServicePolicy_tooltip: Policy that applies when an exam client doesn't have the SEB client running
sebService.enableWindowsUpdate: Allow Windows Update to run while SEB is running
sebService.allowScreenSharing_tooltip: Allows Windows remote sessions and macOS screen sharing to be used

kioskMode.kioskMode_tooltip: The kiosk mode setting reflects how the computer is locked down in SEB
kioskMode.kioskMode_0_tooltip: This kiosk mode may prevent specific third party software to run correctly together with SEB, like some screen recording software or the Windows onscreen keyboard.
kioskMode.kioskMode_1_tooltip: This kiosk mode is compatible with some screen recording/proctoring software and the Windows onscreen keyboard.
kioskMode.kioskMode_2_tooltip: SEB runs without kiosk mode, switching to other applications is possible. Use this for debugging purposes only.

overall.title: General Security
overall.allowedDisplayBuiltinEnforce_tooltip: Enforces using the built-in display: If none is available, refuses to run
overall.allowVirtualMachine: Allow to run inside virtual machine
overall.allowVirtualMachine_tooltip: Indicates if SEB is allowed to run in a virtual machine or not (in order to prevent potential manipulation)
overall.allowedDisplaysMaxNumber: Maximum allowed number of connected displays
overall.allowedDisplaysMaxNumber_tooltip: If more displays are connected, this are blanked with an orange full screen window
overall.enablePrivateClipboard_tooltip: Private clipboard should always be used beside when working with third party application in managed/virtual machine
overall.enablePrivateClipboardMacEnforce_tooltip: Private clipboard should always be used beside when working with third party application in managed/virtual machine
overall.allowedDisplaysIgnoreFailure: Ignore errors when validating display configuration.
overall.allowedDisplaysIgnoreFailure_tooltip: Needs to be active when using SEB inside a virtual machine
overall.allowStickyKeys_tooltip: Indicates whether the sticky keys accessibility feature of the operating system may be used while SEB is running.

logging.title: Logging
logging.enableLogging_tooltip: The log can help debugging SEB (send it to the developers) and to find out about possible manipulations
logging.logLevel_tooltip: The log will contain the selected log level plus all levels with a lower value
logging.logLevel_0_tooltip: Error includes fatal application and browser level errors
logging.logLevel_1_tooltip: Warning are non-fatal but non-expected or security affecting events
logging.logLevel_2_tooltip: Info includes most user actions including all browser navigation actions
logging.logLevel_3_tooltip: Debug is reserved for information which is only necessary for in-deep program code debugging
logging.logLevel_4_tooltip: Verbose level contains events of all levels

macOS.title: MacOS specific settings
macOS.enableAppSwitcherCheck_tooltip: SEB checks for the command key being held down while SEB is starting up. This prevents using the application switcher to mess with SEB's kiosk mode
macOS.forceAppFolderInstall_tooltip: SEB enforces to be installed in an Applications folder (/Applications or ~/Applications)
macOS.allowUserAppFolderInstall_tooltip: SEB can also be installed in the Applications folder of the current user (~/Applications)
macOS.allowSiri_tooltip: If enabled, Siri can be used by tapping the menu bar icon, Touch Bar icon or shortcut set in System Preferences/Siri (default: hold command space). The Siri window won't be displayed though
macOS.detectStoppedProcess: Detect when SEB process was stopped
macOS.detectStoppedProcess_tooltip: SEB displays a lock screen (requiring to enter the quit/unlock password) if it detects its process was stopped, which can indicate manipulation
macOS.allowDisplayMirroring: Allow display mirroring (affects also AirPlay Display)
macOS.allowDisplayMirroring_tooltip: If not selected, SEB prevents to mirror the main display to another
macOS.allowedDisplayBuiltin_tooltip: Use the built-in display (if available) when only one display is allowed or when switching off display mirroring
macOS.aacDnsPrePinning_tooltip: On macOS <12.1 DNS lookup doesn't work while in AAC. Pre-pinning resolves all domains from Start URL and URL filter rules before starting AAC to mitigate this bug. This allows to use AAC on macOS 11 - 12.0
macOS.allowedDisplayBuiltinExceptDesktop_toolt: Allows to use Macs, which don't have a built-in display (like a Mac Mini or Mac Pro), even if enforcing it is enabled
macOS.allowScreenCapture_tooltip: Allows macOS screen capture (screen shots) and recording (cmd-shift-3/-4/-5)
macOS.screenSharingMacEnforceBlocked: Enforce blocking screen sharing on Mac
macOS.enableMacOSAAC_tooltip: Automatic Assessment Configuration (AAC) Assessment Mode is available from macOS Monterey 12.1 (and Catalina 10.15.4 and >= 10.15.6). It blocks various macOS  (which cannot be allowed optionally, like screen capture/sharing, Siri, Dictation)

clipboard.title: Clipboard Policy
clipboard.clipboardPolicy_0_tooltip: Allows the usage of the system clipboard without restrictions
clipboard.clipboardPolicy_1_tooltip: Completely blocks the usage of the system clipboard by continuously cleaning the content and blocking the keyboard shortcuts for cut, copy and paste.
clipboard.clipboardPolicy_2_tooltip: Continuously cleaning the content of the system clipboard and enables an isolated clipboard only working within the browser application of SEB.

sebVersion.title: Allowed SEB Versions
sebVersion.sebAllowedVersions_note1: Allows to specify one or more specific SEB version(s) that are excepted. A version restriction needs to have to following format:
sebVersion.sebAllowedVersions_note2: Please enter one restriction per line, e.g. Win.3.9.min to allow all SEB for Windows versions starting with 3.9 or newer.
sebVersion.sebAllowedVersions_info: List of text inputs which represent either a specific or a minimal SEB version which is allowed to access the (exam) session using current settings. The version string has the following format: [OS.mayor.minor(.patch)(.AE)(.min)], OS and mayor version are mandatory, OS is either 'Win', 'Mac' or 'iOS', 'min' indicates if version shall be interpreted as minimal version this and all above are valid. AE indicates a Alliance Edition version.
sebVersion.sebAllowedVersions_valmsg: At least one SEB Version has wrong format

registry.title: While running SEB
registry.insideSebEnableVmWareClientShade_tooltip: Activates the 'Shade' bar at the upper edge of a virtual desktop, if existent. If you're not using VMware, this setting doesn't have any effect.
registry.insideSebEnableEaseOfAccess_tooltip: Shows options when the button 'Ease of Access' in the lower left corner is clicked, which offers help e.g. to visually or aurally handicapped persons, like the Magnifier Glass.
registry.insideSebEnableNetworkConnectionSelector: Activates the button which allows to connect to WiFi networks, introduces in Windows 10
registry.setVmwareConfiguration_tooltip: Determines whether the configuration value for VMware Client Shade will be set by SEB
registry.enableFindPrinter: Enable find printer in system print dialog

hotKeys.title: Special Keys
hotKeys.title_tooltip: Settings to enable or block (hook) keys, key combinations and mouse buttons
hotKeys.enableRightMouse_tooltip: Enable to access context menu for Web Inspector in SEB for macOS (use ONLY for debugging).
hotKeys.enableAltMouseWheel_tooltip: Corresponds to 'Allow browsing back/forward' in Browser pane. Disabling browsing to previously visited pages may increase security, because browsing back might allow to leave an exam

proctoring.remoteProctoringViewShow_tooltip: Controls the general policy for the initial display of the proctoring Window in SEB. Theses setting have no effect on the proctor's broadcast or chat function.

screenProctoring.title: SEB Screen Proctoring Settings
screenProctoring.enableScreenProctoring_tooltip: Enables the screen proctoring for SEB. Note the this cannot be used together with other proctoring features.
screenProctoring.screenProctoringScreenshotMinInterval_to: The screen shot interval in milliseconds. This defines the minimum screenshot interval. After a screenshot was sent, SEB waits for this interval-time to listen to trigger again. When a trigger-event happens, SEB makes a screenshot and send it, waiting again for the next interval-time to listen to trigger again.Trigger shall be any mouse, touch or key input.
screenProctoring.screenProctoringScreenshotMaxInterval_to: Defines the maximum interval between two screen shots in milliseconds. This is used if no user-interactions happened since last screen shot. In this case this shall defined the maximal interval time between two screen shots if no triggering (user-interaction) happens
screenProctoring.screenProctoringImageQuantization_toolti: Indicating to use black/white, grayscale or color quantization.
screenProctoring.screenProctoringMetadataURLEnabled_toolt: Enable the recording of browser URL input during a screen proctoring session
screenProctoring.screenProctoringMetadataWindowTitleEnabl: Enable the recording of the title of the active window during a screen proctoring session
screenProctoring.screenProctoringMetadataActiveAppEnabled: Enable the recording of the name of the active application. The active application is the one with the actual user focus
screenProctoring.screenProctoringCacheSize_tooltip: Screen Proctoring client cache size in MB per session/exam
screenProctoring.screenProctoringIndicateHealthAndCaching: Show server/connection health and caching status in the Dock/Taskbar icon and its tooltip

This Exam has no SEB settings attached yet.

main.activeSEBClientsNote: There are currently active SEB clients connected to this exam. Therefore it is not possible to change the SEB Settings. Please make sure there are no active SEB clients connected to the Exam before edit the SEB Setting.
